page.title: 03COMMUNITY C. BLACKBURN 1
page.content: Brookhouse Community Centre was built in 1910 as Bangor Street School and was taken over in 1972 by the Youth and Community Service. The building was renovated in 1979/1980. There are nine full time workers, eight half time workers and forty/fifty part time workers.Full time workers all have college qualifications but the part time staff are all volunteers. LANGUAGE CLASSES. The centre offers several adult English language courses. Currently there are two men's classes and five women's classes. There are also two Urdu classes for English people. Men and women are taught in separate rooms. The English language courses are usually attended by people of Indian or Pakistani origin.
